description:
While in San Francisco to Run the S.F. Marathon we visited this gem of a chinese restaurant to replenish our calories from running the race and it was perfect.  we love chinese food and eat it a lot in Los Angeles and this restaraunt ranks up as one of the best. 

We started our meal with rhe lettuce pockets filled with minced chicken...Delicious! As our main course we shared Mushu Pork, Honey Walnut Prawns and Mongolian Beef.  everything was absolutely delicious.  We enjoyed our meal so much we took what we didn't eat back to our hotel to eat for breakfast (cold chinese for breakfast is the best!).

So, if you are ever in San Francisco and want chinese food,  this place is a must!  You won't be sorry.
author: Mark C.

description:
Super yummy meal in this cozy, modern Chinese place in Cow Hollow.  We enjoyed the chicken lettuce cups, Mongolian beef, walnut shrimp and mu shu pork.  All were exceptional, with very fresh ingredients.  Even the mu shu pancakes were clearly homemade.  Business was brisk, but we were not rushed.  Tables and chairs are close together, so get cozy and make friends.

We will definitely be back!
author: Debby C.

description:
My go-to Chinese restaurant in San Francisco! Why? Quality food and great customer service. Isn't that what we all want!

Yes it's probably more Americanized Chinese. But Gary and Christina, owners extraordinaire... are full-blooded Chinese! They provide a beautiful, intimate restaurant.... I would call of contemporary design on Chestnut Street in the Marina District of San Francisco... one of my most favorite areas. It is truly an area where the locals live, eat, shop, work out, and get their hair and nails done:-). My point is, in order to stay in business, you better provide a great product in this neighborhood. It is not a tourist-only locale.

The food is fresh fresh fresh! I say this with confidence because I have eaten here so many times. Always different food items and each one never disappointing. I have my favorites for sure but I try and order one new thing each time. The wine list is incredible. There are not too many Chinese restaurants where you can dine AND  have an incredible California wine from which to choose. Or a really good beer to pair with the spicy food. They offer a Navarro Gewurtztraminer wine which pairs the best with Chinese food. My favorite, however, is their Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc. I'm sorry I make no apologies for wanting really good wine with my outstanding Chinese food :). And I love they take reservations. I also want to note the takeout business they do. My goodness... you would think they were giving the food away. Again these are the locals who live in the neighborhood wanting quality food at home. And I see these people in the restaurant with their families and I love it. My last visit I noted two solo diners ,  obviously locals ,  enjoying their food. Their wait staff have all been there for a long time and that is certainly a good sign. The young woman that waited on us this last visit is just so nice and so accommodating and always wants to make your visit an outstanding one.

The price point for this quality food is incredible. I don't know how they offer the quality ingredients and generous portions at these prices.

This last visit was as outstanding as ever. I always enjoy seeing Christina at the front taking care of business now that her children are grown.

Thank you Christina and Gary for providing such a quality restaurant.
P.s. did I spell Gewurztraminer right LOL
author: Lizz Z.

description: I have been going to this restaurant on and off since it opened.  They must be finding it difficult to employ good cooks because it has become so unreliable.  Prices keep going way up and portions keep shrinking. Ordered the pork pot stickers (4 for $12.00), I thought they made a mistake and used some kind of tasteless chicken, the texture was completely off and it was mushy.  Never had a pot sticker like that and hope to not have another one.  Another time I ordered the Hong Kong Noodles ($15.00), was a soupy concoction that again was without acceptable flavor.  I know good chinese food, and this is not it, especially now.
author: B.K. M.

description: I've been here once before about 8 months ago and thought the food was excellent but this time around it was a disgrace. The one star is mostly for our server John who was great and attentive. The food was cold, lacked flavor and just bad. I had to asked for salt as the food was that bland. Don't waste your money here.
author: D. C.

description:
Bottom line:  Cozy, quality, friendly Chinese dining experience.

Context:  Visited a few times over the past few years, either solo or with my boyfriend.  We live nearby; for some reason we haven't gone much in the past, but I think we may visit more often in the future.

Service:  Very friendly and attentive.

Food:  On our most recent visit, we ordered green tea; beef chow fun; savory, sweet, stir-fried beef; and tea-smoked duck.  This was enough for two people's dinner, plus leftovers.

Dragon Well Green Tea : Mild and enjoyable.  The menu said it was wok-roasted.  I did not pick up on the roasted flavor, but my boyfriend did.

Beef Chow Fun : Satisfying.

Savory, Sweet, Stir-fried Beef : We both liked the texture of the broccoli, which was cooked, but still a bit crisp.  My boyfriend really enjoyed this dish, though I was not quite in the mood for sweetness.

Tea-Smoked Duck : Overall good.  Had a definite smoked aroma, and tasted of tea. It was interesting, but in general, we like the taste of duck on its own, so probably prefer more traditional preparations of peking duck.  The buns, though, were perfectly done - warm, fluffy, and mild in taste.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: I used to love their Kung Pao chicken. But now the diced chicken cubes are getting smaller and smaller, and there are enough peanuts to feed an elephant. To top it all off? The takeout container is only three quarters full at best. They really shouldn't be cutting corners like this when they charge $14 for the dish.
author: Kristen S.

description:
I have been really impressed every time I've dined at Dragon Well. The dishes are flavorful, but not greasy at all. 

The chicken and vegetable stir fry is one favorite - a nice mix of veggies with chicken, cooked in a light sauce. I've also enjoyed the lettuce wraps and found the fried rice not unnecessarily heavy. Additionally, whenever I am sick I order a large hot and sour soup to go and it always seems to do the trick!
author: Holly L.

description:
I love this place.  In fact, I like it so much I eat here several times a month.

The dragon beef is delicious, the lettuce cups are served in very large lettuce leaves, the sautéed veggies are made with carrots, bok choy, broccoli, mushrooms, in a light garlic sauce.  

Everything is ala cart. 

The chicken salad and veggie salad (tofu added) are light and tasty.  The dressing is delicious.

The won ton soup (small cup served)  includes 3 or 4 won ton, fresh spinach, scallions in a tasty broth.

I could go on and on.  You won't be disappointed.  It's a great neighborhood place, with lots of regulars frequenting it.  It's consistently good.

Professional service, and you're never rushed.
author: Lois L.

description:
Great Chinese food experience. I went there with a group of six. We made reservations beforehand since the place is small. There was a one minute delay getting our table together and the manger gave us an order of chicken lettuce wraps on the house for our trouble. 

The server was very good. He made menu and wine recommendations and didn't come off as pushy or like he was trying to get us to buy the most expensive things on the menu. 

My wife is gluten free, and even though the restaurant had a separate GF menu, the server still pointed out good choices for her.

We ended up getting six dishes, plus two orders of pot stickers. The potstickers were very large and tasty. The Kung Pao Chicken (GF) was great, as were the Mongolian Beef (GF) and Beef Chow Fun (GF). The Chow Fun, in particular, was nice... Light and with a smoky flavor.

For non-GF dishes, we got Mu Shu Pork, Walnut Prawns and Savory and Sweet Beef. The mu shu was the weakest, but still good. Walnut prawns had a light batter coating on them, but they still had the tails on underneath. Everyone liked the beef.

Some people have complained about the prices of the meals, but I found them pretty reasonable for downtown San Francisco. The servings were pretty large, and each dish was $15-20, which I think is fair. That's about the price of a decent cheeseburger at a lot of downtown places.

Overall, it was a great experience. My in-laws, who regularly visit San Francisco, said they would be going back.

My one recommendation is that you make reservations because the place is kind of small.
author: Tom D.

description: For starters I came in because I Uber and I picked up a lady who purchased food from you guys and it smelled good. So once I arrived to the area again I decided to give it a try. When I came in i had my work clothes on so that may have thrown the two men off that were at the front counter (the place seemed to have a really nice dressed older crowd)They did not acknowledge me and finally one of them came back and asked if I could be helped and I told him I was there to pick up my order. I picked up the order and it was mediocre at best. The food was very bland. I had ordered the barbecue Fried rice and potstickers. Needless to say I will never come back
author: elise j.

description: The venue looks nice and cute! The food are ok! We ordered beef chow fun and chicken vegetables! The staff are friendly but the service is a little slow. Another thing I don't like is that rice doesn't come with main dish, we had to order and paid extra. Asian dishes should always come with rice. Probably won't be back!
author: Green B.

description: Abolsutely horrible customer service. My 85 year old grandmother came in to pick up a phone order and we accidentally ordered one more item than we wanted. When she asked to take that item off of her order the manager refused and laughed in her face telling her she either takes the whole order or nothing. Called to talk to the manager about this incident and he actually laughed at me. Horrible customer service and manager is a pompous JERK. Don't spend your money here.
author: Nicole S.

description: Pretty good food but recently raised their prices by more than 70% on some items. Bummer, we used to go about once per week but will have to find a new spot.
author: Jeff B.

description:
This is an upscale Chinese place.

I ordered the hot and sour soup and a tea. It was good, the soup clearly had great, fresh ingredients and very little (if any) added msg. It's the kind of place I'd take my parents versus going here myself.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Dragon Well, on Chestnut Street, has been a family favorite.  But, it is my first time here.  The restaurant is bright and decorated with colorful photos on the wall.  We received a friendly greeting and even though is was Friday at noon, we had our pick of seating.  Come 12:30, the tables were filled.

For lunch, we ordered family style:  Won Ton Soup, Beef Chow Fun, Salt and Chili Pepper, and Ma Po Tofu with pork.  The calamari came in medium sized pieces on a bed of fried Won Ton strips.  It was a little greasy, but crispy with the an appropriate amount of salt to bring out the flavor.  The Jalapeno jalapeno pepper slices were more of a garnish.  I ate all of the slices, since my Mom and sister left those to me!  The Ma Po Tofu with pork had a nice spicy kick to it.  Enjoy it with rice.  The small cup of soup was crammed with four Won Tons.  I liked the Beef Chow Fun.

The service was well-paced, with a small break between and appetizers and our main meal.  At the conclusion of our meal, a bowl of fortune cookies was brought to us, regular and chocolate.

I recommend stopping by while you are in the neighborhood, but since this is Chestnut Street, you may have to circle around for parking or walk a bit further if you park in the neighboring streets.  Three stars for the food and one extra of the good service.
author: Jeff P.

description:
This Chinese restaurant is pretty good.

I visited this place a few times.
The last time I went there, I took a Jook and the Chicken noodle soup. They told me to wait 15mn, so I walked around on Chestnut Street, I came back 15mn later and It was ready. Both soups were delicous, and my friend even told me she will come back for that Chicken noodle soup.
author: Michael T.

description: We are from out of town and wanted to try out some local Asian food and I have to say that this place did not disappoint us at all. My boyfriend and I got 3 different types of food and shared them, because we couldn't decide on just 1 each. So if you're local or just visiting I highly recommend it and the prices are reasonable. Also the staff are friendly and attentive.
author: Leticia J.

description:
This is more like a mall food court's Chinese food: salty, greasy, with huge chunks of scallion or onions everywhere.  Avoid this place for both food and service! 

I have received consistently bad customer service for both dine-in and takeout.  After a couple times of each (there isn't much choice for Chinese food in the neighborhood), I refuse to come here again (especially after prices went up).  The older Asian lady (manager?) is always rude and condescending.  $10 for 4 potstickers is no bueno in my book and $16 for Mongolian beef (let me tell you, the $16 doesn't buy you flavor)!
The potstickers tasted fine, but having tried a few entrees, nothing else tasted good at all.  Lemongrass chicken- gross.  Beef chow fun- grisly pieces of beef. I grew up near Monterey Park in LA and know what delicious Chinese food should taste like.
author: Kari L.

description:
Ordered $150 worth of lunch to-go today and was endlessly berated by the owner because I called and asked (VERY NICELY) if they could please bring it to the sidewalk, and that I will gladly tip. I explained how there was no parking anywhere so I stopped directly in front of the restaurant... so close that I could throw an egg roll and hit the front door with it. They could see me waving at them when they picked up the phone. What REALLY pissed me off in the whole rant was when he angrily said something like "this is asking for a lot!" - regarding my request to bring the bags and credit card slip to sign (TO THE SIDEWALK IN FRONT OF THEIR DOOR). I didn't want to get a ticket, which is why I stayed in the car. 

If the owner ever reads this: For me to have requested that you walk out to the sidewalk and hand me two bags and a check to sign is NOT asking a lot... especially for a $150 order. Consider the average bill for this place, and how many times you'd have to walk back and forth from the kitchen to service a table. 

As I'm signing this check, he continues to angrily berate me about how there's a table upstairs, and people on the phone, and how they don't do this... etc etc etc.. AND THIS GUY IS THE OWNER! There was maybe one or two tables seated in the main room, and I could see that because I was right outside. Even if there was a table of eleven somewhere, it wouldn't have made a difference in the very inappropriate manner in which he behaved. Insult on injury- he voluntarily told me (as he walked away) that there were no utensils and that I would have to figure that out myself. 

I didn't say much to prompt this type of behavior... I was stunned and shocked that I could barely get words out of my mouth. I can't believe I even followed through on my promise to tip for a to-go order to be brought to me, in front of their door. 

There won't be a next time, and I will refuse to bring food from this place to ANY of the offices I work with. I told my clients this today as well. They won't be patronizing your establishment again either. My clients told me that I should have just left and have him eat the $150 order... I'm too nice for that, even though this establishment didn't deserve my kindness or business.
author: Jen H.

description: i go here easily once even twice a week i love it here. The food is amazing but i am not giving it a one star at all over food if not for the lack of disrespect i felt from the waitress. I asked for chili oil which he brought me yet it was empty. I asked him for another one and it was empty. I asked again and the third time was the charm. IT was a bit over 68 dollars for our food and im the person who tips by how good the customer service was and his was not the best. I tipped him 10% of what my check was. As my husband and i are leaving he stops us and says if we can leave a 15% tip because at the restaurant it was a policy. I told him thats all i had in cash we had paid in card and could have easily left a tip on it but it was a lack of service. My husband told me to add on the card and i was about too but i simply told him you know what i always leave what i left depending on the person and the simple fact that you asked for more tip is absurd. We left and i was very upset and not sure if i will be back.
author: Lizz C.

description: This place is fantastic! We have ordered from here so many times when we are looking for a delicious hearty non-greasy meal. The chicken chow mein is DELICIOUS and non-greasy. Lots of fresh veggies in it as well. We also absolutely love the pork pot stickers and the hot and sour soup. We would also recommend the my shu pork, eggplant and kung pao chicken. Order extra and you can make a stir fry of the leftovers the next morning! This is the place to go if you're looking for some delicious Chinese food!
author: Emily R.

description:
The Dragon Well could be something great...

The menu here is limited all fitting on one page but even with a smaller menu the food doesn't get enough of the attention it needs, in my opinion the food needs a lot of help most of what I've had here was either bland or salty.

The waitstaff here is very kind and friendly so that is a huge plus and the only reason for the extra star.


Appetizers :

- Salt and Chili Pepper Calamari- 2 stars on a good day but it will either be too salty or soggy and bland which was what I experienced with the dish last night. Definitely not worth the $13.

- Tea Smoked Duck - 4 stars, It's very tasty but even for being an appetizer the portion is on the smaller side.

Soups: 

- Won Ton Noodle Soup - 2 stars - The broth on this soup is very bland , I always see everyone adding large amounts of soy sauce or chili to it in a failed attempt to make it better. The noodles in this soup seem to just be in one big block and when you actually taste them they just taste like the were covered in flour or left sitting in some starch. The won tons are the only thing in this soup that is quite tasty on it's own.

Veggie Courses:

- Stir Fried Vegetables - 1  star- Once again what could be a great dish is hit with the curse of blandness. This would be great with something as simple as a little more salt and pepper. 

Veggie Fried Rice - 4 stars - This dish  was as tasty as it was hearty, If I ever come back this will be my go to.

Dinner/Main Courses:

- Chicken Chow Mein - 4 stars The noodles are on the thinner side but overall this was dish was tasty and the pieces of chicken were tender and flavorful

- Kung Pao Prawns - 0 stars -  This was a huge disappointment and a dish I'd advise against ordering if you love Kung Pao Prawns. When I think of Kung Pao Prawns , I think of crispy prawns with enough heat with celery and peanuts. This dish reminded me of buffalo wings :(  The sauce the prawns where tossed was so tart and vinegary that none of the heat that was supposed to be there came through. It came with a mix of broccoli and cauliflower and peanuts which were the best part of the dish.  ** For switching out the chicken for prawns there is a $4-$5 fee which would be fine if the dish was  actually good but it's not :// 

- Stir Fry Chicken and Vegetables - 3 stars - The chicken was quite tasty and flavorful while the veggies were lacking.

- Seafood Bird's Nest - 3 stars only b/c the best part of this dish is the actual nest made of potatoes and who can hate on potatoes. The scallops were and prawns were ok in flavor not too great but also not entirely disappointing, the calamari I had to actually stop to make sure it was in there because of the tiny mini pieces you get in the dish. 

- Stir Fried Salmon - 4 stars This was the tastiest dish imo , The salmon was tasty and the tofu while I thought the pieces were too big very nicely absorbed the sauce they they were served in, If I'm ever dragged here again I'll make sure to order this dish. 

- Crystal Prawns - 0 stars this dish could be great but once again there is no seasoning. It comes covered in a mound of soy beans too many for the size of the dish. 



The Dragon Well is one of my least favorite places for Chinese food. I've been here about 4 times b/c of family and unless I'm dragged here I won't be back.

Save your time and money & just  find another Chinese spot.
author: Glenda A.

description: Excellent food that doesnt make you feel like you drank a gallon of milk real fast..... very and delicious. You taste the food not the grease!
author: Tim J.

description:
Small spot where people cram into the narrow entrance for either take out or to get a table. Food portions were a good size. The flavor just was not worth the $30 for Hong Kong Noodles and pork dumplings. 

The noodles came as a fried side which requires the liquid from the meat and veggies to soften up.  Was expecting actual noodles. Reminded me of opening a pack of top Ramen and dumping sauce on top. Won't order it again. Don't know if I will be back.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Dragon Well might just be my favorite part of SF. Seriously though. I have Celiacs and normally can't eat Chinese food... like ever. I can't even really eat at most places that offer GF selections because they don't have a 100% GF kitchen, I'm that sensitive. It makes dining out super stressful but at Dragon Well let them know you're GF and they'll give you a full GF menu so you can browse freely and don't need to ask about every dish. For a minute I can pretend I'm normal, in a normal restaurant, ordering like a normal person AND I didn't get sick! It's a miracle, Dragon Well is Chinese heaven on Earth.

Get the Bird's Nest. It's definitely my favorite but I also am a big fan of the Chicken Chow Mein... just get both, Dragon Well leftovers are the best. 

If you're a spicy food person the Mongolian Beef is good, the Lemongrass Chicken is even better. 

The service we found to be mixed, some nights we went it was incredible and then other nights not as good but honestly, for me, it doesn't even matter as long as I get my Dragon Well fix.
author: Emily B.

description:
I had high hopes for Dragon Well. I was there once previously, and although did not find service all that spectacular, had no real complaints. The food was good "Chinese gourmet." 

My second time at Dragon Well was a complete disaster. The phone was already ringing when I entered. I waited to be seated. A waiter approached dragging his feet. Instead of acknowledging me, he took his time putting away some receipts. I tried to ask about being seated. He cut me off before I could produce a full word, saying he had to answer the phone. 

He took the phone order. I looked around. There was a family seated in the front and another waiter eating lunch in the back. 

Finally I was seated. As I looked at the menu, another man walked in and seated himself. He asked the same waiter for the menu. Instead, the waiter answered another phone order and then took mine. 

The man asked for the menu a second time. I shook my head in disbelief of the terrible service. I tried to settle down, but as I was looking around the restaurant, the waiter eating in the back had a napkin stuck up his nose.

I had it. There was no way I was going to pay $20 plus tip at a restaurant where waiters don't take there jobs seriously and the customer is ignored.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I love this place. Best Chinese food in San Francisco. The pot stickers are thick and yummy, not the hard tiny mass manufactured like other places.  

The chow Mein is to die for. I get mixed with all meats. If off menu but they do it for a little extra and it makes great breakfast the next day. 

Yum yum!
author: Jason H.

description: Very good food and service. Place was clean. I recommend the Mongolian beef. It had a nice spice to it.
author: Kenia F.

description: Yay! Gluten freee menu! So exciting. So hard to find great gluten free Chinese food! Yum!
author: Caitlin M.

description: Really good spot for Chinese in the Marina.  The best potstickers in San Francisco, and a host of dishes that are significantly fresher and more thoughtfully prepared than the average:  especially the Mu Shu Pork, unique and more mindfully done than the dense mash of julienned cabbage and meat you get everywhere else.  Friendly service too.
author: Peter L.

description:
Superb food, mostly good service, welcoming feel.
 
BUT, we were appalled when a customer with a dog was seated.  It seems every dog in SF is labeled as a service dog.  Although I'm a dog person, I believe animals don't belong in restaurants.  The host did not say a word to the patron.
author: darcy f.

description:
The hubby and I were pleasantly surprised by Dragon Well.  The food is very fresh and flavorful, and we really appreciate the use of high quality ingredients for traditional dishes, which can be difficult to find in SF.

I was craving rice porridge and Dragon Well's delicately seasoned chicken porridge hit the spot perfectly.  The hubby enjoyed his veggie mu shu and also the tea duck.  Surprisingly, the stand out in the tea duck dish for us was the super fresh buns.  

The sizes are modest but suited to the price point, quality, and location.  The service was friendly and efficient.  We went on a rainy Sunday evening and the restaurant was half full but we saw a steady stream of folks coming in for pick up.  We look forward to returning here and trying other dishes!
author: Kelly K.

description: Poor customer service and bad food. We have been customers here for about a decade. After tonight, it was the last straw and we're not coming back. I was already thinking that their food was poor quality. What tipped the scales tonight is that I got reprimanded for taking 5 of their cookies with my to go order. The soup is big enough for me and the kids and my son was in a bad mood and so 2 of those cookies went to him. I was already overwhelmed and this was just another unneeded kick. That'll be the last time I'm coming there.
author: Joe S.

description:
Dragon Well was a solid gluten free find in San Francisco, and you can bet I'll be back next time I'm in town. 

We walked from Ghirardelli square, after being all touristy and checking out all the chocolate, and found this restaurant to be in the cutest hipster neighborhood. Around dinner time, there are so many 20 and 30-somethings walking around, and the street is alive with restaurants and shops alike. We only waited maybe five minutes on a Saturday night for an open table. I read a review that stated this place is somewhat like a local P.F. Changs. It isn't at all. The flavors were way more original, and it reminded me way more of going to a hole-in-the-wall Chinese place than some Americanized chain.

I was so excited at all the gluten free options on the menu that my dad and I way over ordered. We got the lemongrass chicken (surprisingly spicy), Mongolian beef (drier and spicier than I'm used to), and the chow fun noodles (a little bland and thicker noodles than I expected). Each dish alone would have left us with leftovers. But on the plus side, we had enough extra food for lunch the next day! 

Although I wasn't particularly blown away by anything I had, I definitely want to try more things on the menu. The prices were SO good (around $12 a dish), and the variety, atmosphere, and location really can't be beat.
author: Kate L.

description:
The fried rice had a very "clean" flavor--finding fried rice without grease can be a challenge.

Had a mix-up on what I thought I had ordered and they knocked 50% off the price of the dish that was served (and eaten)!
author: Miriam S.

description:
The place that always hits the spot!  
Dragon Well.
Dragon Well.

We always start with their wonton noodle soup, so tasty and always fresh.
Mushu Pork is wonderful.
Mongolian beef perfectly spiced.
Pot stickers large and juicy.
Seafood nest, melts in your mouth.  If you like fresh ginger, you'll love this dish.

Whether you dine in or take out, it's consistantly superlicious!
author: Michelle A.

description:
This place has the BEST potstickers in the entire world. My Chinese Grandmother is turning over in her grave right now for me saying this! 

To put it lightly, I am a potsticker enthusiast. A connoisseur, if you will. I have spent many years in search of the perfect potsticker: not too doughy, not too thin, not filled with bullshit cabbage and skimping on the meat, perfectly crispy and so on. I could wax poetic on this for days. 

I have lived in the Marina for 13 years and for the better half of it, I avoided this place like the plague for a number of reasons. Mainly because I left like it was fancy Chinese food and the place is filled with the standard annoying, yoga pant wearing women and bros of the marina. The menu is also lacking in that I think there are something like only 14 entrees offered. And cashew chicken isn't one of them! Major fail. 

Anyhow, one hungover afternoon, after having already tried and written off all the potstickers within walking distance, I bravely entered Dragon Well, determined to ignore all the exposed toes on the flip flop and salmon colored shirt adorned bros. I ordered the pork potstickers, well done with a side of hot oil: standard operating procedure. My order was ready before I was able to analyze and think terrible thoughts about all the patrons and moseyed on home with my bag of delight.

I opened the box expecting disappointment and was blow away at the sight and smell: they were the perfect color of brown, beautifully crisped and smelled of absolute heaven. Eagerly, I took my first bite. I was instantly hooked and was transported to a happy place I never knew existed. Complete perfection on every level. 

After weeks of ordering the same thing, even sometimes getting two orders (4 pieces of this perfection is just not enough sometimes), I had to compliment the host on these delicious little wonders! He told me that there is one lady who is the dedicated potsticker maker. That is her one and only job: to make these fabulous and perfect potstickers! How could this be?!! One lady who's sole purpose of employment was to make these little bundles of joy? I was bewildered and amazed. But it makes absolute sense: these fucking things are so perfect, they found their ace and realized she was worth the specialized role as I don't even know if anyone else on the planet could ever replicate such perfection. 

Speaking of perfection, the hot oil is so delicious I could bathe in it. I also had to ask about this. It turns out it is made with garlic and is pressed to perfection and is void of all those annoying chili flakes that can make an otherwise perfect oil have moments of bitterness. 

If you enjoy life, like to eat, then you MUST have an order (or 3) of their potstickers. If you don't, please go fall down some stairs as the world doesn't need your kind! Now get off your phone, laptop or computer and do yourself and your tummy a favor: go to dragon well and get the MF'n potstickers. 

You can thank me later.
author: Lucia V.

description:
Very good food served by an agreeable staff that was so attentive our teapot was refilled before it went empty.  This is a small restaurant, simply decorated with a moderate noise level when full.

Their moo shu pork came with steaming fresh pancakes, I liked the kung pao chicken very much and their steamed dumplings were the best I've ever had. The shrimp with walnuts, though tasty, had mayo on them and lacked flavor so I can't recommend that dish. The hot and sour soup is more on the sour side, but excellent. 

I thought this Chinese restaurant was a good value because of the high quality of the ingredients and the exceptional service.
author: Lynn S.

description: Good for a quick meal or takeout.  Unfortunately they only answer the phone half the times and will also leave you on hold forever. The service is also pretty disinterested.
author: Jeff S.

description: Got raw pork in my potstickers with no apology. Were surly about " we won't charge you."  Uhh that's right, you won't. And I won't be back.
author: Roberta D.

description: The service was good and the staff was friendly but the food was disappointing. The Kung pao chicken was a joke. It was mostly onions and peanuts with a few small bits of chicken thrown in. The flavor was good but I didnt want a plate full of peanuts I wanted chicken and they did not deliver. I really wanted to like this place but overall I wasn't satisfied and won't be returning.
author: Nicole C.

description: I highly recommend this place. Food is great, service is excellent. You should try their hot and sour soup.
author: Dunja Z.

description:
Ordered the Chicken Jook, and some beef and salmon entrees, but there was hardly a taste to any of the food at all. The white rice was also soggier than it should be (and is also not Jasmine Rice, at all) They do have a good brown rice though, a semi sweet brown that was actually pretty good. 

The jook was the most disappointing. It's like it's just made with a weak broth, meat simmered rather than a bone simmered stock.  Was hoping to get a soup to beat back a cold, but this one definitely won't be doing that.

Maybe Out The Door's rice porridge has spoiled me, but this stuff is way too expensive for it to be so tasteless.
author: Annie W.

description:
This place is a SF favorite year in and year out.  The food is absolutely spectacular.

It is a busy restraint, expect a wait most nights and realize at least 40% of the food is take out.  

Green Beans, Kung Pao, Butter Fish, Chinese Salad, walnut prawns are to DIE for.

The Duck is outstanding.  I seriously have not had a single thing on this menu that had not blown me away.  Beetle Nut on Union was inspired was inspired by Dragon Well and the owners are always here making sure the food is perfect.

Downside:  not a full bar

BEST DISH OVERALL:  Tea Smoked Duck
author: jennifer w.

description:
I love this place. A friend of mine brought me here for dinner and it couldn't have been better. 

The service was great, we got to chat with the owner who was so nice, our server was great and made sure to check on us and make sure we were taken care of. We got the tofu and vegetables and the won ton soup, and some vegetable potstickers to share. All was so yummy! Great flavor, cooked well, will definitely come here for dinner again soon.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant, being half Chinese I have eaten so much Chinese food growing up and so many restaurants, this place has good Chinese food. Good atmosphere, nice people working, great experience.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Very yummy indeed! Ordered through Postmates and was very pleased with what we got: Spicy Hong Kong Noodles and Scallop Yi Mein. We also ordered potstickers which were very well seasoned and fresh. Please note you will be served the thicker potsticker rather than the thinner gyoza style version. Even though gyoza is obvs Japanese, a lot of Chinese restaurants serve them and call them 'potstickers' (a la Trader Joes) so I like to include them in my order when trying a new place just to see. I look forward to trying this place again! 

My usual go to place is San Tung in the Sunset, but Dragon Well may become my second favorite soon!
author: Nina N.

description:
Closed out Sunday Funday with a Chinese meal from Dragon Well last Sunday.  The food was solid.  The quality of the ingredients was apparent.  Had the calamari not that memorable, the lettuce cups which were amazing, the Dragon beef was ok could have used some more spice, the salmon was delicate and tasty,  the walnut prawns were again amazing.
Solid food but could be a bit more spice.
author: Robert H.

description:
Nice Decor and fast Service (lunch). Lemongrass chicken was awesome. Wok fried prawns were ok and chowmein was ok.

Food was just warm...I wish it was hotter. It got cold by the time we ended up eating the dishes.
author: Nitin B.

description:
In town on business, and I wanted some famous sf Chinese food.  The food does not disappoint here, though the decor is more modern feeling than I was expecting. That did not affect my review, but I mention it in case someone reading this is looking for a certain vibe from this place.  
I had the pot stickers, steamed, the wonton soup, and the Mongolian beef.  All were very good, and the only reason the review is not 5 stars us that the food needed more seasoning.  That's all that was wrong. Service was friendly, quick, and accurate.  Ovetall, a great experience!
author: Smitty S.

description: I eat here all the time.  Best Chinese!! Great Gluten Free Menu.  Dragon Beef is Legit.  Definitely order it.  Lettuce cups are also a fave.  This place is worth your while and if you order to go you can eat it at the Marin Lounge next door, and get a decently priced cocktail.
author: Kitty B.

description:
Special because of cleanliness, better than average atmosphere, pleasant service and great food.
Food is prepared without the usual excess of oil, but still with great flavor and preparation. It was amazing to have moo shu pork that was not taking a bath in oil; served piping hot, and with perfect, just steamed wraps. Yum!
Re the pot stickers, yes they are unique for their freshness and delightful unique pork filling. Perfect combination of crispy shell but so soft and fresh in the middle.
author: Michael M.

description: This little restaurant is located in the heart of all the action on Chestnut. Arriving without a reservation on a Saturday night, we were greeted by a very friendly front desk woman, later learning she is an owner. We scored with the front table that opens on to Chestnut. We skipped ordering an appetizer and went straight to ordering chicken chow mein, savory sweet stir fried beef, crystal prawns, kung pao and streamed rice. I noticed a lighter touch with the dishes, a good thing. The stir fried beef was a bit too sweet for our tastes (this is our error because "sweet" is in the title and we should have known better!). The crystal prawns lacked a lot of sauce flavor but the flavor of the prawns themselves came through but was just a little plain. I will admit to always wanting to find Kung Pao chicken that matches my favorite from another restaurant. This Kung Pao was good, just did not match my favorite. But good food overall. What sets this place apart is their service. Our water glasses were refilled constantly and our waitperson was so attentive. Meanwhile, the owner continued to greet each new patron and phone call with the same friendly and welcoming manner. This was a pleasure to see and we look forward to a return visit.
author: Jillian R.

description:
I've eaten here on average once every other week the last 10 years. It's the best Chinese food you'll find in the Marina, no SF, no ANYWHERE! Always fresh, lots of vegetables, better cuts of meat, and not greasy like so many other Chinese food restaurants. I've had everything in the menu and it's all tasty.
The owners and staff a some of the nicest and attentive people.
Dragonwell is a gem!
author: Jon D.

description: Celiacs and GF peps this place is for you! The food is awesome they have a full GF menu for us. The staff is very nice and well knowledge of gf. One of the only gf Chinese food places in the city. Definitely will be coming back!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
My only favorite Chinese food restaurant in the Bay Area that does not have MSG in their food! 
Their Black Bean Chicken is the best dish on the menu! Loooove it! It has just the right amount of spicyness to it.
The service has always been good and kinda stay away from the chocolate fortune cookies, they look good but the chocolate tastes funny. Stick with the regular old fortune cookies.
author: Cherie E.

description:
We had a delicious dinner and can't wait to go back! We had chicken in lettuce cups (appetizer), hot & sour soup, lemongrass chicken, and pea shoots. Everything was great with good seasoning & flavor. Clean restaurant, nice ambiance. 
We are also fans of Hong Kong Lounge 2, Dragon Beaux, Ton Kiang, Yank Sing and Eliza's (for reference) - so we've eaten good Chinese food to compare. 
Wandered in after a movie, but Dragon Well will now be a destination for us.
author: Ruth C.

description: Awesome hot n sour soup...the Scallops and wild mushrooms in a sweet salty tender and tasty noodles.  A great lunch...the scallops are fresh and flavorful...all goes perfectly with a Tiger beer.  Of couse in Singapore at the Maxwell Food center this dish is $3 bucks...here you need to multiply that by 4x plus....but...this is the Marina district....a great neighborhood.  I will be back to the Dragon!  Great service and ambiance.....lots more on the menu.
author: David G.

description: I order takeout from here every few months and eat here less often but every time I do, i ask myself "why am I not eating here WAY more often?"  The food is excellent - fresh and delicious  - not at all greasy or salty like one of the other reviews mentioned. I can't profess to trying everything though I would expect if I ordered a deep fried entree, that it might be greasy....but that isn't what I order.  The salmon dishes are excellent, the fried rice dishes and noodle dishes hit it right out of the park for us.  The service is great and it is a great place to take kids.  Will continue to be a staple and we will be going here more often even!
author: Coco L.

description:
Dragon Well is our favorite place for gourmet Chinese food. 

The food is always excellent. We have so many items in rotation. We love the Pot Stickers and Minced Lettuce Cups appetizers, Won Ton Noodle Soup, the Chinese Chicken Salad has the BEST citrus vinaigrette, and the Sichuan Green Beans are a perfect balance of spicy and savory. 

The above items are our personal favorites, however, everything we have had on on the menu is delightful. 

The only drawback is because the food is outstanding, sometimes it's hard to get through on the phone! If at first you don't succeed, keep trying, it's so worth it!!
author: Lauren O.

description: 7/12/2017 Was not prepared for chilly weather in California in July,   Boy was this New Yorker surprised.  I needed soup in July, a sentence I didn't think I would be saying.    Hotel  suggested we go to Dragon Well,  EXCELLENT suggestion.   Ordered the Salt and Chili Pepper Calamari and the Won Ton Noodle soup.   Afterwards had the hot tea. There was more than enough food for two people, the soup was filling, it had everything.  The " kitchen sink " of soup!  Our waiter was extremely friendly, as he told us about additional areas to visit in the area.  Meal was leisurely, we never felt rushed.   From the outside the restaurant is unassuming, very easy to pass up, I would recommend if you are in the area to try it.
author: Liliana B.

description:
Got lunch at this place the other day and it was super good. All I the Chinese food that I have had lately is kinda sketchy and chewy so I was pleasantly surprised to get such tender meat. I was also pleased that it didn't have the typical tacky decor. 

I got the Mongolian beef and it was very flavorful and had a great texture. The best part was that it was only $14 with tax and tip and I had left overs to bring home! 

The staff wasn't suuuper friendly but I was on my break from work and wasn't looking for small talk anyway. 

Overall, it was good ad will go back.
author: Jessi G.

description:
I remember when this place opened service has gone down and so has the food. 
When the wife runs it it's great, when the husband does it's a no go. 
Sad it went downhill.
author: Lauren F.

description:
I love dragon well!
Every time I go to the marina I try to stop by.
Lettuce wraps are yummy appetizers.
I wish the Mongolian beef was spicier but it's still very good.
author: E A.

description: Always solid. Every time. Been coming here for years. Love the Kung Pao and their Chinese Chicken Salad is fresh, healthy, and delicious. Super friendly staff as well.
author: J P.

description:
Probably simply the very best Kung Pao chicken I have ever try. Always crave for a good Chinese inspired food and this place never disappoints. Simple, delicious food which is cooked at the extreme high heat of wok which cannot be replicated at the home kitchen. 

Sweet and sour soup was super tasty as well. Small but very well composed menu with all dishes proved to be a great take out place as well. 

Recommended ! Two thumbs up!
author: Xela H.

description: I've been going to Dragon well for over a decade, and having lived close by it quickly became my favorite restaurant. It can be very busy and noisy for evenings and the wait can be long, but I love the consistency of the menu and can always rely on my favorite dishes to be there, like walnut prawns and the garlic eggplant.
author: N S.

description: Small portions for a large price.  Taste ok, but not the usual Chinese Cuisine.....very sterile mixed with Japanese flavors.  Seems like they are trying to be ultra-modern..... not a traditional Chinese Restaurant at all.
author: Annette C.

description: I ordered the Pork Pot Stickers. Although I prefer my dumplings/potstickers to have a thinner wrap, these were very good. The filling was tasty and flavorful, you get 4, and they are on the larger side. Add a lychee iced tea and call it a happy snack!!
author: Shawnta W.

description: For a restaurant which embraces its longevity in the neighborhood I was extremely disappointed by the food, service and atmosphere at Dragon well. The entire restaurant feels sterile, and the food matches this blandness in taste, texture and overall plating. The wonton noodle soup lacked almost all flavor, lest it be drown with enough soy sauce to compensate for it's  flavor, but absolutely nothing could be down to minimize the rubbery noodles that we were served. I don't know how this business has been open 18 years, but I strongly recommend you take your pallets elsewhere for tasty food in the marina
author: Rob R.

description:
Wow! Delish! Yum!
I can't believe this place only has three and half stars. I was immediately impressed when I entered the restaurant. I was promptly greeted by the owner and seated by the lovely window seat. The restaurant was quite busy, but the owner and other staff were very attentive throughout our meal. My husband and I ordered three dishes: pork fried rice, walnut prawns, and moo shu pork. Within a ten minutes all three dishes came steaming hot from the kitchen. Everything looked and smelled DELICIOUS! The pork fried rice was served on a fairly large dish. It could feed four people if you had other entrees. The walnut prawns were cooked and seasoned to perfection. The moo shu pork came with four tortillas and was also AMAZING! I wish I could have eaten more, but I was stuffed by the end of the meal. At the end of the meal, the waitress brought a huge bowl of fortune cookies. It was a  mix of chocolate or regular. We each got to pick out our fortune. Not only was our meal good, but was so was our fortune!
Support a family owned and operated restaurant in San Francisco! I would highly recommend this establishment. Thanks for the wonderful evening and memories!
author: Stella K.

description:
Food was okay, a bit pricy for being only average.

Service wasn't good at all. We ordered for takeout and when we got home we noticed an item wasn't included. I called the store to see if we got charged for the missing item and the woman on the phone said she didn't understand what I was talking about, she instructed me to go online to check the food prices and hung up without another word.

After comparing my bill with the online menu prices it appears that I didn't get charged for the item that was left off of my order which was a pleasant surprise. As I went in to pick up my food I overheard an employee tell another customer that they were unable to make the item I was missing but I was never given the same notification throughout any of the process, I would have ordered another dish instead.

Took a little over 30 minutes to get which was a few minutes under the 45 minute estimation. Enjoyed the food for its convenience but with so many other restaurants in the city I find it hard to imagine I'd give them my business again.
author: Chris K.

description:
The chicken the China...the Chinese Chicken!

Oh, Pardon me as I  Reminisce  about my teen-aged years.
And the on going success of the "Bare Naked Ladies" 
I only bring them up because, the lyric and connection to Chinese food.

Brings me to the same thought.....I DON'T LIKE EITHER OF THEM!

Okay, at gunpoint, I would eat Chinese food, or if (My opinions are outnumbered
due to the majority) who want to suggest OTHER Food.

Now since, I am about as pompous as the "Marina" crowd
basically, as shallow as a shower. I think I am entitled to good food.

I want good quality food, I really didn't think it was going to be in the 
arms of "Dragon Well" and it is American television style Chinese elegance.

The food has a good sense of healthy grit to it. 
Not overruned by MSG or food flavored subitutes and it should be this way
it's delicious dishes are very common but the service is the thing that gets the stars.

Now the place is very small, but that's what makes it a adorable...
with it's "take me out on a date, please it's our 3 month anniversary type joint." 

They were accommodating for our table of 5.
We all ordered separate dishes, but they were all pretty good.
We had to wait about "20 minutes", which turning until "an Hour"
 to get seated, and because of the longer duration for seating,

Management gave us the complimentary. "Spring rolls"
they were awesome, the wait staff was beautiful, friendly, good eye contact,
polite...enough to make their mothers proud.

Here is how I will scale everything on a scale from 1-10

*Springs rolls = Crispy, refreshing, free..the bamboo shoots threw me off. (7)

* Stir-fried Chicken w/ Vegetables is delicious it has bok choy, and carrots, 
   mushrooms, ginger and garlic. Didn't taste frozen, but good enough to feed 
   two people, and I think I was scammed on the chicken. (8)
 
*Savory, Sweet, Stir-fried Beef 11 
  Flank steak stir-fried in a rich, sweet and tangy sauce; served over stir-fried broccoli.

Yeah, they are legit, as far as Chinese food goes.

P.s. - There was a alcohol beer that was there, It had a large percentage of alcohol.
           If your reading this, and find out what it is, let me know!
author: Michael R.

description: Yes, it is Americanized.  Yes it is both pricey and often has small portions.  Still, in my decade in the Marina, this was a place I frequented, particularly for the soups.  It was a luxury to eat here, but a modest one.
author: Steve S.

description: I had the chicken stir-fry and it was bland as bland can be. It sucks because this is one of the only "chinese" places in the Marina.  I would go with something else.
author: Matty S.

description:
One of the worst, most over-priced meals I've eaten in SF.

For about $45, I got fried rice, walnut prawns, and stir fried vegetables (wow, a little pricey?!). 

Walnut prawns were covered in globs of gross mayonnaise; I would've asked for it without but the menu never even tells you there's mayo on the dish! All of it is just thrown on a bed of stale lettuce taboot; yuck.  

Fried rice was boring, with only pork, scallions, and egg cooked inside. The menu says there's peas and carrots (which would've made it taste better), but I didn't see one piece of either.

Vegetables had no flavor, and were barely cooked. I still have a gross aftertaste from whatever was in that crap. Also, tons of tofu. I know it's vegetarian, but I expected more real vegetables, and not tasteless soy product. 

All of this would've been okay had the price been apt, but $45 for three dishes?! Absurd. And on top of that, it took about 40 minutes to make my food (it was a to go order!), even though they said it would take 15-20 minutes. 

I will never go back here, and I don't recommend you do either (there is another Chinese place down the street).
author: Noah D.

description: Excellent service despite being packed around dinner time. The hot n sour soup is delicious, and tastes fresh and flavorful. Ordered the wok tossed prawns, which was tasty and although not a huge portion, was a perfect portion to share. Would highly recommend!
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Over the top 
One of the Chinese restaurant EVER 
Clean and modern great service 
Loved every bite 
Great value fast and the staff first class
author: Stefan B.

description: Food and service always excellent. Our "GoTo" for healthy, high quality Chinese. Very nice family run restaurant. Love their pork fried rice, wonton soup, walnut shrimp and moo shu pork.
author: S R.

description:
Great service. Came here with 7 children, the waitresses were very helpful, they had fried rice and some chicken and veggies, they loved everything. Colorings are also provided for little ones.
Adults had a mix of good starters, spring rolls, calamari, lettuce cup and gyoza (latter dough was too thick).
Entrees, we took Mongolian beef, HK noodles, won ton soup, all plates can be shared for 2. Waitresses again advised us well on choice and we ended with a full bowl of fortune cookies that ended the evening cheerfully.
author: Emilie D.

description: This place is a MUST while visiting the Bay Area- phenomenal Chinese food, great menu. Best potstickers and lemongrass chicken I've ever had.
author: Lauren M.

description:
I hate giving restaurants undeserved stars for mediocre food simply because they're the only place in a neighborhood that dishes up a certain type of food (Saiwalks).

Luckily, Dragon Well is not one of said restaurants.  Sure, it's a bit white-washed Chinese food, but it's actually pretty darn delicious, and it's become a quick pick-up staple for Husband and myself, especially on a chilly night.

My favorite is the chicken jook, though it's really pricey for mushy rice (try Chinatown joints for a huge bowl for only $5).  I've actually never had a bad meal here, and considering its location in the Marina, where real Chinese food is practically nonexistent, it's really a pleasant surprise.

If you are stuck in the Marina and crave Chinese food, Dragon Well is a solid pick.  If you want a more budget-friendly and authentic meal, definitely venture to the Richmond, Sunset, or Chinatown.
author: Tori S.

description: The Mongolian beef here is some of the best I've had. The wonton soup is awesome! My wife and I always crave it when it's cold out (you know, July in SF..). Tip: Always go for the cup of wonton soup. For some reason the bowl is different. They add other stuff to it that isn't as good as the cup.
author: Vlad B.

description: Tried this place on a whim while walking by. Had the Mongolian Beef and my husband had the steamed Salmon. Loved every bite
author: Jay R.

description:
I'm not sure why the total score for Dragon Well was lower than I had thought but after reading some of the reviews, it appears that many are from out of the area, complaining about take out etc.

This place is the BEST for healthy, non-greasy, bright al dente cooked vegetable and multi-layered full flavored food !!  I have been in San Francisco for decades and this is the only place I crave when it comes to Chinese cuisine. The others are just Meh and often overcooked, greasy and off flavor.

The staff are very professional, kind and yes, when the place is booming with the others who realize the food is THAT good...........and your here with the other 250 getting take out, there may be a glitch or two ! ...How about checking the bag before you leave to avoid a mistake cause they will gratefully correct the error.

WE LOVE DRAGON WELL !!!

PS........I am not a family member, owner or have any other connection with this tasty place !
author: Robert M.

description: Dragon Well is my favorite Chinese restaurant.  Really unique tastes, no msg, very healthy.  The minced chicken lettuce cups are so tasty, the wonton noodle soup is my mainstay with plenty of prawns and chicken, the chicken chow mein is my husband's favorite -- not greasy and a real fresh taste, the crystal prawns super healthy and light, the hot string beans are outrageously wonderful.  We've been going there since it opened, and Christine and her husband are really great hosts.  Makes locals like us return and return for our Birthday parties and special events.  I like the food at Dragon Well much better than a recent $1300 bill for 2 at SF's 3 Michelin star restaurant.  WPJ
author: W P.

description: I know Monday is not prime time, but everything was just off tonight. Service was slow, rice was cold, and the formerly wonderful fish was slathered with too much soy. Server was nice but completely forgot the drink order (surprising as this is usually a profit center. Sadly DW now appears to be past its glory days (and nights).
author: Boris G.

description:
I usually come to Dragon Well for casual dinners w friends. Love this place, it's super clean and the staff is soooo friendly and accommodating.

Foods to try:
Dragon Beef - it's amazing! Get a side order of rice for this dish

Walnut Prawns- yummy, I think it's the best I have had at any Chinese restaurant!

Wok-ness Prawns- it's a little sweet but really yummy battered prawns in an awesome sauce.
author: Sepi N.

description: I don't know where to begin!  My father and I stumbled across the restaurant on a Friday afternoon and ordered the wonton noodle soup and the dragon beef.  We were so impressed with the quality of the food (the beef was like filet) and the service that we had to stop again for dinner before flying home on Sunday.  We re-ordered the same two dishes but as we had a 3rd person we added he Ma Po tofu and the hostess treated us to an order of the beef Chao Fun.  We definitely have a new favorite on Chesnut!!  Oh, order the Ma Po Tofu extra spicy!!!!
author: J J.

description:
The best Walnut Prawns! Ever! 
Mongolian Beef was also really tasty! 
I'm glad that I discovered this restaurant.
author: Victoria A.

description:
Love this place! Been here several times and it never disappoints. Here's the scoop:

Ambiance: nice decor, more for a low key dinner, more intimate but not too fancy.  Versatile restaurant that is great for dates, family, or groups. Friendly service and I notice they do pick up.

Food: fresh and good quality. Always get the chicken chow mein, and sometimes get the sweet beef dish, and walnut prawns. Usually have leftovers and they are great the second time around! Also the chocolate fortune cookies are a nice touch!

Price: around 9 to 13 an entree, and definitely shareable. For a group of 4 I would suggest 3 entrees and a regular size brown rice.

Accessibility: takes reservations but it's usually not too difficult to get a table for a smal group.
author: Roya B.

description: This place deserves way more stars. The area where it's located is nice, clean and safe. Food is delicious and it is ready in no time. Portions are big enough to share if you are not extremely hungry but not huge for a good lunch for one person. We ordered noodles with chicken and bbq pork fried rice, both for $12 which was the only adequate price we've had lunch for in San Fran this weekend. Our server, Alexander, was super sweet, attentive and helpful, and chocolate fortune cookies just put a cherry on top. If I ever come back to San Fran i will have lunch there every day!
author: Katya G.

description: Poor management dirty if you see where they store there food you will never eat there again it's next to about six waste can next to the building the Asian guy is a jerk I don't kno if he is the owner or not but how he treat his employee burns me up this place need to be shut down but lucky for him well just send the healthbroad  there instead no stars I hope the picture of the food store next to the waste bend don't shut him down oops
author: Jade V.

description:
I normally eat here pretty regularly but after my experience last night with the owner, I won't be back.  I always add extra Bok choy to my wonton noodle soup.  Extra implies that there is bok choy already in the soup.  This soup is the main reason why I kept coming back.  Now apparently there shouldn't be any bok choy in the soup, which is news to be since I have been eating here for almost 2 years.

My main issue is that I, very nicely, called and said that normally when I ask for extra bok choy, you can tell that there EXTRA bok choy - the soup appears greens due to the amount that they kindly add for me.  The woman on the phone very nicely says she is sorry and to come over and she will give me the extra bok choy on the side.  She also asks if I would like some more broth on the side and I say sure and thank you because i think it is very nice.  

I walk all the way back to the restaurant to have an owner blatantly disrespect me verbally.  She very obnoxiously tells me that I am wrong and that she has had the restaurant for 15 years and never has it included bok choy.  I explain that I know what I am accustomed to eating and only recently started asking for EXTRA bok choy.  She continues to contradict me in front of many other patrons in the restaurant.  How embarrassing.  She tells me it is just spinach.  I know the difference between bok choy and spinach.  But thank you for trying to imply my ignorance.

I choose my battles wisely and wouldn't just for the 'sake of it' call and tell them that they didn't include what they normally do.  I wouldn't take time out of my night to walk all the way back to a restaurant for no reason after I already returned home with my fiancé.  This restaurant is not cheap and yet we continued to go because of their service and there BOK CHOY IN THEIR WONTON NOODLE SOUP!!!!!

This owner really needs to take a step back and realize that how you treat people will directly affect your business.  This is one of the first times I have dealt with her and my suggestion is for her to stay in the back with the kitchen or stay home.  She absolutely ruined my experience.   I am beyond disappointed in her lack of tact in handling this matter and will be certain not to come back.  I have also gone ahead and told all of my friends who live in the Marina and Pac Heights not to eat there anymore.

Oh and I never got the broth either.  Don't offer something and then decide not to give it.
author: Christina D.

description:
Good food and nice atmosphere!
Ask for the beef chow mein, it's not on the menu but they will be happy to make, it's delicious
Parking is hard..
author: Keri A.

description:
My and my boyfriend were looking for somewhere to eat and stumbled across this place. 
We started out with the potstickers and then shared the Chicken Chow Mein and the Wok Fried Prawns. All three were delicious! 
The service was great and the food came out fast. 
I was overall very satisfied and would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Abby A.

description:
I had a craving for Chinese and  found my way to Dragonwell.
Hostess was charming and lead us to a perfect  table as soon as we arrived.  Water glasses were filled as soon as we were seated, with lemon-wedged water.  Our server was absolutely delightful and arrived as soon as we were settled.
We ordered potstickers and Spring rolls as an appetizer and several additional items for the main.
Appetizer were hot and delicious , served with tasty sauces .
Our waitress monitored the meal meticulously, and as soon as we finished appetizers , the mains arrived.
Mongolian beef; walnut prawns ; fried rice;  each dish was hot, tasty and well-prepared .  We gorged , enjoying every bite .
Some reviewers have complained about lack of seasoning .  I suggest ask for soy sauce and salt and adjust to your taste .
I love this place !
author: Kevin W.

description:
This is best in city fresh not greasy cook to order 
the hot & sour soup is just right not a bowl of corn starch  
their chicken Chinese salad has a lot of chicken with a sweet dressing topping it off
 
Have been coming since they opened & continue to come here bringing family & friends it makes an impression on them they tell me when they come to sf have to go dragon well
author: Jay J.

description: Best spring rolls I have ever had. (Mustard sause is spicy but can just be ignored for the red mild one) Combine with rice and soya saus and you have a whole meal. Fast service a big plus! Would def go back.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Love this place food is amazing and it is sooooo clean
I would go everyday and everyday if I could
author: Hasmik N.

description: Ate here by myself while visiting the city. They were pretty busy but still gave quick and attentive service. I ordered the wok-tossed prawn and when I took my first bite I thought it was one of the best things I ever put in my mouth. Very tasty! The oolong tea and jasmine rice were an added bonus. Great place for a quick tasty meal. Price reasonable for what you get. Comfortable atmosphere.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
This review is way past due.  We've been coming here for several years and every single time we've eaten here has been a great experience.  The food is always great and every member of the staff is extremely nice.  

It's so nice to have a reliably great place to eat.
author: heather h.

description: Very poor take out experience.  Ordered fried rice and was told it would take 25 minutes - which seemed a little excessive to me.  Came back 20 mins later and saw the rice sitting on the counter.  However - the front was slammed and very crowded.  Took them 15 minutes to even acknowledge me.  Cold food now and expensive for what you get
author: Peggy F.

description:
Here for lunch around 130pm on a Wednesday.  My bias is for relatively quiet, uncrowded venues with some elbow room, and they did not disappoint (other lunch spots along Chestnut, even at this hour, were pretty packed).  

Very friendly, quick service.  Some jazz music in the background.  I had brown rice with vegetables, enjoyed it; my friend had the kung pao chicken.  I also had a cup of the hot and sour soup, great, especially on a cool, foggy day.  Chocolate fortune cookie!  Lunch special prices I felt were reasonable given the very nice ambience, quality food, and good service.
author: David C.

description:
We have only had one take-out experience with Dragon Well, and not yet eaten in their restaurant.  We were craving good Chinese take-out recently, and my parents had previously suggested this restaurant, so we gave it a try.  We were very pleasantly surprised with the food and overall experience, and we are sure to try them again, and perhaps eat in their restaurant sometime as well.

We arrived on a busy night to make our pickup- the restaurant was full and many people were waiting, and since parking is hectic around there- my wife ran in while I double-parked.  Our food was ready on time, and as we discovered when we arrived home- very well packed.  We had their very excellent pork pot-stickers- a great crisp and delicious through and through.  We had the tea-smoked duck with buns- this was my favorite dish and I will make sure to order it every time.  We also had a beef chow-fun, which was a bit bland for my tastes however my wife enjoyed it, and an order of crispy spring rolls.  Last but not least was the walnut prawn dish, which we both enjoyed very much.  The menu was not 'overly ethnic', but still lots of variety and quality ingredients at decent prices.

My lack of excitement over many other options will surely have me ordering from here again.  I'd rather drive here than have several of my 'regulars' deliver to me, if that means anything.  Worth a try if you are in the area/live nearby- I think you will enjoy.
author: Andy S.

description: Incredible food. Hands down the best chinese i've had and i've travelled to china. As an aperizer I highly recommend the chicken in salade leaves and for a main dish I loved the spicy chicken. The staff was super as well. Very attentive, helpful and friendly. The waitress actually noticed that we weren't served a dish yet and made sure we had it asap. A great finish to the evening where the chocolate fortune cookies ! Overall great exlerience - definitly coming back when I visit San Francisco again.
author: Michelle W.

description: My friend came to SF and was craving gluten-free chinese food. She wanted something more authentic than PF Chang's so she was thrilled when we found this place. They have an excellent Gluten Free menu for anyone with Celiac disease.   We ate off that menu and it was good!  Our favorite dish was the lettuce cups - the chicken was flavored just right with ginger, cilantro and broth.  The vegetable fried rice was actually not very oily or greasy, but it also lacked flavor.  That worked out well because both the beef and the green beans were super super spicy.  Service was also really good.  Definitely recommending for anyone that is gluten-free due to Celiac or other real actual gluten intollerances.
author: Miri R.

description: Favorite Chinese food in SF. Fresh ingredients, consistently great. Family owned, very friendly.
author: David D.

description:
I wasn't very impressed with Dragon Well.  Actually, the only Chinese place in the city so far that has really impressed me was San Tung in the sunset.  

I came here with my family from out-of-town because the wait for Delarosa across the street was too long.

We ordered:

Hot and Sour Soup - 2 stars (one of the most bland I have had)
Mongolian Beef - 3 stars
Lemongrass Chicken - 3 stars
Chicken w/Vegetables - 2 stars (needed some extra flavor, but the fresh veggies were nice)
Vegetable Chow Mein- 3 stars 


Overall, an average dining experience.  The service was a little on the slow side.  I probably won't go back, but if you are hungry, the food isn't horrible.
author: Juliana K.

description: Good food and good service.  Slightly over priced but the food was fresh so thats okay. For the most obvious reasons why its overpriced is because its in the the Marina area.  I will keep this place in mind next time in the area and looking for some Asian Fusion food.
author: Lilly K.

description:
Not Gay Friendly
Have been to this place several times. When I'm alone it's great service. When I'm with my partner it's poor quality. There is one server in particular. My partner and I visited last night (11/19/12) and had the same waiter as previous times visits. White, stalky guy, blonde/brown hair. He always get a part of our order wrong, takes a long time to serve us and completely ignores us during our meal. For refills or extras we have to bother a busser or other staff. 
When the bill comes, we wait and wait and wait. Last night we walked up to the register to pay. Wait, wait, wait.
Sad. Poor. Bad. Shame on you.
author: Dustin S.

description:
Dragon Well is easily my favorite chinese food place! I wish they delivered!!! They are pickup only :( but it is so worth it!! Their chicken chow mein is probably one of my favorite things on this planet. Its what I would take with me on a desert island. The chicken and vegetables lunch menu item is a perfect healthy pick me up for lunch. Don't get me started with the pot stickers, I dream about them. The mongolian beef is super yummy, I ask them to make it very mild because I don't do spicy well and they always do it for me. 

The staff is always so friendly and personable. I've only ever ran into one young, tall, brown haired guy who wasn't very friendly but maybe he was just having a bad day but I've seen him on multiple occasions and he wasn't very nice but oh well...

I highly recommend you try this place. Its a little pricer for Chinese food I will admit but to me the service, ambiance, and quality of food is so worth it!
author: Natalie M.

description:
I generally go by the rule of thumb that a real good Chinese Restaurant has a B-rating on their window and a waitress or server that I feel hates me but Dragon Well is the exception to my rule.  

With a beautiful layout and Chinese flare to it, Dragon Well is a nice place to go if you are looking for a nice family restaurant for reunion, anniversary, or fancy first or second date.  High ceiling and large windows are perfect for this place.  

The chocolate fortune cookie just put a smile on my face for the rest of the day.  

Was a bit uncomfortable with the low MSG/healthiness of the place at first, I have to admit, but I forgave them for that.  But, If you're used to the hardcore Chinese places, you might want to ask for 2 bottles of soy sauce because you might have to add a little to your rice and entree.  I'm not gonna lie, I added about half a bottle.
author: Hazel K.

description:
Somehow, I ended up getting take-out here.
Their Chinese chicken salad is decent. The place gives you a good amount of roasted chicken breast meat that is moist/not dry. The dressing is this lemon-soy vinaigrette, and it seems they also put in dry mustard for a slight kick. Good leafy ingredients. I felt healthy eating it. I'll give the dish a 3.5-star rating for being a non-dry chicken salad in the Marina District.
author: Derek N.

description: Bland and mediocre Chinese food with no flavor. No General Tso's chicken on menu. Kung pao chicken is decent..Vegie spring rolls were good.
author: JP S.

description: I love dragon well. Maybe it's just me. Yes it is just me. This place has great chinese food especially their hot-and-sour, veggie dumpling, and kung pao chicken. I probably go to this place twice a month. I always ask for extra peanuts in my kung pao and they deliver every time. I always leave this place feeling like I had a feast so make sure you wear your loose fitting pants.
author: Michael S.

description:
I want to start with this: For the love of God chopsticks are NOT DRUMSTICKS.  It is not that funny, nor is it really all that creative, but it is highly, highly, HIGHLY annoying. It's bad enough when it's kids, but adults? Really?

Moving on...
The food has always been great. I REALLY want to like the ambiance. But when they have an off night, boy do they have an off night. For example, last night we went. They kept telling us, "It won't be too long". 25 minutes later there were still 4 uncleaned open tables, several people working and a lot of attention on the check out. It really didn't seem like the right hand knew what the left hand was doing. It felt really chaotic. And not in that "busy night at the restaurant" kind of way.

I do love the fortune cookies at the end, but wish they'd use some tongs and not let everyone put their hand in the bowl. Always creeps me out and generally pass on the cookie.
author: Brie P.

description: Maybe 5 stars is extravagant for a simple, local Chinese restaurant, but I've been a loyal customer for years at lunch and I think there food is excellent, inexpensive and easy.  Occasionally I wish there menu would change it up a bit, but my truth is I order the same things over an over, anyway..  Chicken salad, moo shoo, chicken won ton, and a noodle dish that includes shrimp, beef and so much more.  Portions are large enough to share. Service is always kind, responsive, enthusiastic.  A side note, I love Chinese food, but don't like "gloppy" food.  This is a clean version of what I love.
author: Barbara M.

description: Great sit down Chinese food. I'd definitely like to come back and try more items. My first time here and first time anywhere in the marina.
author: Mark G.

description: Everything was super yummy and the service was good.  Great place to go with a group and share plates.
author: Rachel R.

description:
How could I have neglected to write a Dragonwell review after all this time?

"Neighborhood Chinese Place" taken to a whole new level.  Consistently excellent preparation of both creative and classic dishes.  Sure they've been slightly Americanized, but here all that means is better quality ingredients and less grease.

Great setting and the finest staff in town.  Much better wine list than your local joint too.  

A neighborhood gem!
author: Mitchel H.

description:
Great place for a Chinese lunch or dinner in the Marina District.

My favorites are the pot stickers and the Kung Pao Chicken. The latter is done right, with just chicken, peanuts, scallions, peppers, etc., and none of the filler veggies that a lot of places use.
author: Doug L.

description:
Everything was amazing. From service to the food.
Stopped by because everyone else was packed due to the Giants game. Quickly got seated and greeted by Emily. She was very accommodating and tentative to needs. Had a glass of Navarro wine? I think that was the name, it was a little too sweet for my liking but paired well with the food I ordered. I will be coming back for sure. Thanks
author: Harley M.

description:
Oh hey, Dragon Well staff. I'm the girl who was talking about porn with her male companion the entire time (I'm sorry if we were too loud, but it was really funny) and kept dropping grains of rice onto her arm. Ugh. So embarrassing. And in fact that was the only negative thing about dinner - it was pretty hard to eat my Kung Pao Chicken with the chopsticks. But the taste was well worth it, I assure you.

Nice decor, also, and super friendly waitstaff. Plus, hello, chocolate fortune cookies? I thought at first they were just "well done" - yes, sometimes my cluelessness amazes even me.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Americanized Chinese food, but not that I have a problem with that.  Heck, I'm Americanized Chinese.  So then what is my problem with Dragon Well?  Um, Panda Express tastes better than you.

The Marina would never be my go-to spot for Chinese food, but the bf had Dragon Well takeout on a late worknight and, the good bf that he is, brought home his leftovers to share.  The hot and sour soup tasted as if a bunch of spices and tons of pepper had just been thrown together.  I felt like I was drinking a peppery spice rack concoction.  The beef chow fun wasn't any better, and I had to douse the dish in Sriracha to give it any flavor.  Also, the dish was all noodles - there were only about three pieces of forgettable beef along with a few strands of bean sprouts and some green onion. 

This was quite possibly the worse display of Chinese food I've had.  I am so glad this meal wasn't on my dime, and needless to say, you won't find me eating from here again.
author: Mel T.

description:
Wow; surprise to my palate... simply did not expect this nicely decorated and invitingly busy place along Chestnut to have good Asian flavor. 

It surprised me! *plus the name of this high quality tea from the famed Hangzhou lured me in as well (well done, marketing)~
